citations.narrative:
On April 16, 2024, Viola, a female Asian elephant (54), escaped while being bathed outside the Butte-Silver Bow Civic
Center in Butte, MT while traveling with the Jordan World Circus. Two elephants, Viola and Isa, were being bathed
outside in a U-shaped area closed off by section of steel crowd control fencing with four attendants present. A pickup
truck with loud pipes/backfire startled everyone. Viola was nearest the fence and knocked it down and started walking
west along civic center drive. Two handlers immediately followed Viola while the other elephant was secured, and one
handler remained with her. With three attendants closely following, Viola walked along the north edge of the civic center,
into the road and then back onto the east side of the street reaching a green lawn where she started calmly grazing and
remained until the trailer was brought around. Viola was loaded onto her trailer without incident. The entire event took
about 12-19 minutes. No human injuries occurred. Viola was examined by a veterinarian, found to be free of injury or
distress and cleared for performances the same day. The elephant could have been injured or caused injury as it walked
along the city street. Elephants must be housed in enclosures which are structurally sound and in good repair to protect
the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
To be corrected by 5/2/2024.
The evening performance of the circus was observed on April 30, 2024. Two Asian elephants, Viola and Isa (both F, 54
years old), were inspected at the Central Wyoming Fairgrounds, Casper WY on May 1st, 2024. This inspection and exit
interview were conducted with the elephant handler.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
On April 16, 2024, Viola, a female Asian elephant (54), escaped while being bathed outside the Butte-Silver Bow Civic 
Center in Butte, MT while traveling with the Jordan World Circus. Two elephants, Viola and Isa, were being bathed 
outside in a U-shaped area closed off by section of steel crowd control fencing with four attendants present. A pickup 
truck with loud pipes/backfire startled everyone. Viola was nearest the fence and knocked it down and started walking 
west along civic center drive. Two handlers immediately followed Viola while the other elephant was secured, and one 
handler remained with her. With three attendants closely following, Viola walked along the north edge of the civic center, 
into the road and then back onto the east side of the street reaching a green lawn where she started calmly grazing and 
remained until the trailer was brought around. Viola was loaded onto her trailer without incident. The entire event took 
about 12-19 minutes. No human injuries occurred. Viola was examined by a veterinarian, found to be free of injury or 
distress and cleared for performances the same day. The elephant could have been injured or caused injury as it walked 
along the city street. Elephants must be housed in enclosures which are structurally sound and in good repair to protect 
the animals from injury and to contain the animals.  
To be corrected by 5/2/2024. 
 
The evening performance of the circus was observed on April 30, 2024. Two Asian elephants, Viola and Isa (both F, 54 
years old), were inspected at the Central Wyoming Fairgrounds, Casper WY on May 1st, 2024. This inspection and exit 
interview were conducted with the elephant handler. 
 
 n
